Elisabeth_Andreassen:
{{short description|Norwegian-Swedish singer (born 1958)}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Elisabeth Andreassen | image = Elisabeth Andreassen.JPG | image_size = 200px | landscape = Elisabeth Andreassen in 2010 | alt = | caption = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Elisabeth Gunilla Andreasson | native_name = | native_name_lang = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1958|3|28|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Gothenburg]], Sweden | origin = [[Ullern]], Norway | death_date = | death_place = | genre = {{flatlist| *[[Country music|Country]] *[[musical theatre|musical]] *[[Pop music|pop]] *[[Rock music|rock]] *[[schlager]]}} | occupation = | instrument = | years_active = 1979–present | label = | associated_acts = {{flatlist| *[[Chips (band)|Chips]] *[[Bobbysocks]] *[[Kikki, Bettan & Lotta]]}} | website = }} '''Elisabeth Gunilla Andreassen''' ({{née|'''Andreasson'''}}; born 28 March 1958), also known simply as '''Bettan''', is a Norwegian-Swedish singer who has finished both first and second in the [[Eurovision Song Contest]]. ==Career== Her talent was discovered in 1979 by Swedish musician and TV host [[Lasse Holm]]. She was produced by [[Bert Karlsson]]'s label [[Mariann Grammofon AB]]. In 1980, she joined Lasse's group [[Chips (band)|Chips]]. Chips participated in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1982]] with the song "Dag efter dag" ("''Day After Day''"), and reached 8th place. Andreassen is active in many musical genres such as [[country music|country]], [[schlager]], and [[Musical theatre|musical]]s. She is mostly famous from [[Eurovision Song Contest 1985]] when she and [[Hanne Krogh]] participated as [[Bobbysocks]] with the song "[[La det swinge]]", and won. Andreassen has sung in various genres such as [[country music|country]], [[pop music|pop]], [[rock music|rock]] and in [[musical theatre|musical]]s. She plays three [[musical instrument|instruments]]; [[guitar]], [[piano]] and [[contrabass]]. She has also been a revue and musical artist. "Bettan" has a record as the woman with the most participations in the [[Eurovision Song Contest]], tied with Sue of [[Peter, Sue & Marc]], and [[Valentina Monetta]]. She has participated four times, three times in duets (with Kikki Danielsson in 1982, Hanne Krogh in 1985, and [[Jan Werner Danielsen]] in 1994) and once on her own (in 1996). ==Personal life== Born on 28 March 1958 in [[Gothenburg]], [[Sweden]], to [[Norwegians|Norwegian]] parents. She lives in [[Ullern]], [[Oslo]], in Norway with her two daughters, born in 1995 and 1997. Elisabeth married Tor Andreassen on 2 July 1994 and after that she took his last name. On 13 June 2016 her husband died of a heart attack.[http://www.expressen.se/noje/elisabeth-andreassens-make-plotsligt-dod/ Elisabeth Andreassens make plötsligt död] ==Hits== *''[[Då lyser en sol]]'' (1981) *''Killen ner' på Konsum svär att han är Elvis'' (''There's a Guy Works down the Chipchop Swears he's Elvis'') (1981) *''Together Again'' (1981) *''God morgon'' (''Good Morning'') (1981) (as [[Chips (band)|Chips]]) *''Dag efter dag'' (''Day after Day'') (1982) (as [[Chips (band)|Chips]]) *''[[La det swinge]]'' (''Let it swing'') (1985) (as [[Bobbysocks]]) *''[[The Power of Love (Jennifer Rush song)|Ängel i natt]]'' (1985) *''Tissel Tassel'' (1985) *''[[Waiting for the Morning]]'' (1986) (as [[Bobbysocks]]) *''Danse mot vår'' (''[[Serenade to Spring]]'') (1992) *''[[I evighet]]'' (''Eternity'') (1996) (''Wir sind dabei'') (1998) *''Pepita dansar'' (1997) *''Lys og varme'' (2001) *''[[Vem é dé du vill ha]]'' (2002) (as [[Kikki, Bettan & Lotta]]) ==Eurovision Song Contest== Altogether, Elisabeth has participated in the Swedish [[Melodifestivalen]], Norwegian [[Melodi Grand Prix]] and the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] fourteen times, plus four ( 1 Times at Sweden and 3 Times at Norway ) as presenter. ===Melodifestivalen=== :[[Melodifestivalen 1981|1981]]. Chips - "God morgon" (Good morning), 2nd place :[[Melodifestivalen 1982|1982]]. Chips - "[[Dag efter dag]]" (Day after day), 1st place :[[Melodifestivalen 1984|1984]]. Elisabeth Andreasson - "Kärleksmagi", 6th place (last) :[[Melodifestivalen 1990|1990]]. Elisabeth Andreasson - "Jag ser en stjärna falla", 7th place :[[Melodifestivalen 2000|2000]]. TV-host, with nine other artists. :[[Melodifestivalen 2002|2002]]. [[Kikki Danielsson|Kikki]], Bettan & [[Lotta Engberg|Lotta]] - "[[Vem é dé du vill ha]]", 3rd place :[[Melodifestivalen 2011|2011]]. Elisabeth Andreassen - "Vaken i en dröm", 8th place in semi[http://svt.se/2.121594/1.2227406/elisabeth_andreassen_ar_klar_for_melodifestivalen_2011?lid=puff_2227412&lpos=lasMer Elisabeth Andreassen är klar för Melodifestivalen 2011!] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110612143516/http://svt.se/2.121594/1.2227406/elisabeth_andreassen_ar_klar_for_melodifestivalen_2011?lid=puff_2227412&lpos=lasMer |date=2011-06-12 }} ===Melodi Grand Prix=== :1985. Bobbysocks - "[[La det swinge]]" (Let it swing), 1st place :1992. TV-host, with [[Jahn Teigen]] :1994. Elisabeth Andreasson and [[Jan Werner Danielsen]] - "[[Duett (Rolf Løvland song)|Duett]]" (Duet), 1st place :1996. Elisabeth Andreassen - "[[I evighet]]" (Eternity), 1st place :1998. Elisabeth Andreassen - "Winds of the Northern Sea", 2nd place :2003. Kikki, Bettan & Lotta - "Din hånd i min hånd", 4th place :2015. Elisabeth Andreassen & [[Tor Endresen]] - "All over the world", 4th place ===Eurovision Song Contest=== :[[Eurovision Song Contest 1982|1982]]. Chips - "[[Dag efter dag]]", 8th place, [[Sweden]] :[[Eurovision Song Contest 1985|1985]]. Bobbysocks - "[[La det swinge]]", 1st place, [[Norway]] :[[Eurovision Song Contest 1994|1994]]. Elisabeth Andreasson & [[Jan Werner Danielsen]] - "[[Duett (Rolf Løvland song)|Duett]]", 6th place, [[Norway]] :[[Eurovision Song Contest 1996|1996]].
